content: saffron shawl 7 to make a larger shawl repeat row 18-25 this chart shows row beginnings/endings repeat saffron shawl 8 to make shawl larger repeat row 18-25 this chart shows apex repeat saffron shawl 9 image to show the first 6 row the progression and shape is a little different than is typical of shawl construction 14 row- more than ½ way through the pattern for the main body the chevron pattern makes the neckline a little wibbly- wobbly this will be corrected by adding the linen stitch neckline and blocking saffron shawl 10 during the first row of linen stitch the keyhole in the center of the back is formed by single_crochet in one foundation chain stitch opposite from a dc3tog cluster ch1 single_crochet in the foundation chain stitch opposite the next dc3tog cluster this also helps pull the neckline straighter or if you want a more faroese shaped shawl omit the keyhole and just work the linen stitch straight across the shawl before blocking may look a little wonky to block the shawl first pull the neckline straight and pin it into place this will take care of most of the scrunching the rest will be sorted by gently pulling the peaks/points/tips of the chevrons downwards and outwards doing so will pull the fabric flat steam-block acrylic wool or natural fibers can be wet-blocked to hold their shape saffron shawl 11 i promise it will lie flat and straight saffron shawl 12
